summary: RADHE: The Most Wanted Bhai is an adrenaline-pumping action entertainer. The story revolves around the rampant usage of drugs in our society and how the youth is getting destroyed in the bargain. The protagonist of the film "RADHE" is a smart and tough cop with a kind heart and witty personality. He usually likes to do things his way to get justice restored in society. How far RADHE goes to bring justice, clean the streets from drugs to save the youth and to restore peace in society forms the crux of the story.

Just another generic and formulaic Salman Khan vehicle which does not work. The action scenes were illogical, the dialogue was bad and the humor was cheesy. Add into the mix the bad music and constantly changing tone. Skip it.

The only thing good about Radhe is its short runtime of 1 hour 49 minutes. This is the kind of film that can give a person brain damage in these already torrid times. If you want to save yourself from this atrocious torture that not even the most ardent Salman Khan fan deserves, you should steer clear of this film. Instead, go and watch Tanmay Bhatt's commentary on Pakistani Uber drivers and their exchanges with their customers on YouTube. It will be a much better investment of your time.

I wish I can get my time back. Don't try to make sense of the movie. Action sequences are dull & numb. Pathetic use of CGI to make Salman look young. Disha Patani & Randeep Hooda didn't have much to save the film. 
For such movies; negative ratings should be allowed.

Movies are based on genres. We should not expect something like Titanic when watching Fast & Furious. Salman makes movies for fans and he was brilliant to create a new genre for his loyal fans. This is why Radhe became a blockbuster and still keep going. This movie has all the elements that Salman fans want. For example world class action, comedy, heroism and an escape from the everyday life to relax and enjoy a good time with family. The sharp editing has made the film better but NY-VFXwaala did a rush job. Well, understanding the lockdown and restrictions the movie had to suddenly face, the team did a great job overall.

Radhe consists of nearly all the elements you would expect in a Salman Khan Film. (Action , Romance and a bit of Comedy). To me , it does not feel like a bollywood film.

Coming from a family of OG bollywood fans from the early 2000s, i can say that it felt like a hollywood film. I could easily tell that it has been remaked by the directors from an american film. 

In terms of acting, the actors were superb as always. Salman Khan being a hero alongside the Living Legend Jackie Shroff. The villains were.... well... villainous and pure evil.

The storyline was really gripping and emotional at some times. As this relates to a real life society like today, we can relate this movie to how we live today. The storyline had a very long buildup which hyped up the climax. Unfortunately, the climax was rushed and didnt feel exciting which is the main reason why i have given Radhe a 3.5 star rating.

A traditional bollywood film features songs which should be really popular for the OG bollywood fans. These songs are absolutely terrible and the only song which was decent was the title track. 

Overall, this film is worthy of a maximum 3 star rating due to its gripping storyline but rushed climax and terrible songs.

I do not recommend this for OG bollywood fans but I DO recommend this for Violence and Action lovers!

Waste of time, there is no entertainment or any story.

With all the negative reviews Radhe movie is definitely acting as an exorcism on the corrupted minds of the addicts.

This movie had picked the topic of drugs among teenager but instead of addressing that issue, this movie was focusing more on salman khan's body and disha patani's figure. Disha patani's role literally gave the feel that the writer had to add her role in this movie under salman khan's request and her acting was terrible on top of it. The romantic scene between salman khan and disha patani was full of cringe and disgust. I literally felt my taste was wasted after watching this movie. Jackie shroff's acting and role was also terrible. I recommend not to watch this movie as it will disappoint you

New variant of Corona Virus - RADHE

There is no need to be feared of Corona Virus because the most contagious virus of all time 'Radhe' is here. Cringe all the time. Only Randeep Hooda's acting is convincing, else the idiotic action scenes and the unnecessary style is trash. I was waiting for a single moment in the film when I would think that yes, there is something in this film, even if its one scene. But, how can a Prabhudeva directed, Salman Khan starrer movie have a good scene (Exception - Wanted). Even the dubbing is not done correctly, lip sync is not proper. Disha Patani doesnt play any significance in the movie, as always she's there just for her glamour. Salman Khan's movies usually have good songs with good choreography but this movie doesnt have that as well. In a nutshell, dont watch it.

Editing of this movie was very crisp. Having a fast paced plot the movie won't bore you at all. The runtime is shorter than other Salman Khan films. The sequence and flow of the movie is totally unpredictable which will keep you at the edge of your seat. Most of the negative reviews are coming from drug addicts that this movie has shed light on. Hope these trollers recover from addiction and get well soon.  The VFX could be better but the action is very well directed. Jackie Shroff adds comedy reliefs which will make you laugh as well. Overall money well spent!
Very enjoyable movie!
